NPS  Acadia National Park is Open   Acadia National Park is open. For more information, visit the links below, or visit our Plan Your Visit section to plan your trip.          A cross-country skier explores Acadia's snow covered carriage roads. NPS  Park Roads All unpaved roads are open for the season. Park Loop and Cadillac Mountain roads are open for the season.  For more information see our Temporary Closures information.        Park Headquarters in the winter. NPS/ D. R. Hunt  Visitor Services Hulls Cove Visitor Center is open for the season. For more information please visit our Operating Hours and Seasons page.        Trail sign in winter. NPS  Seasonal Activities Carriage roads are open to all traffic. The Precipice, Jordan Cliffs, and Valley Cove areas are closed until further notice. This includes The Precipice Trail, Orange & Black Trail, Jordan Cliff Trail, and Valley Cove Trail. Peregrine falcons have returned and begun displaying nesting behaviors. These closures happen every year to protect the state-listed endangered species during their nesting season.         Winter at the Jordan Pond Gatehouse. NPS  Weather Whether sunny, snowy, foggy, icy, or anything in between weather at Acadia can change quickly. Be prepared and check the weather before traveling. For forecasts and advisories visit our Weather page or the National Weather Service.        Birch trees in fall.
